topic.title: India threatens to sue people who even view torrent websites
topic.body:
What can i do to secure myself when downloading?

I know that i am safe with zerotorrent for torrent search.

What about my torrent downloader, I use utorrent.
I have a static ip. is it safe?
I use windscribe to anonymize when i search for torrents but torrent downloads are slow.
i have torrent connection set to encryption forced and
report ip as fake one. i also have ipfilter.dat added.

What can i do to secure myself when downloading?


"This URL has been blocked under the instructions of the Competent Government Authority or in compliance with the orders of a Court of competent jurisdiction. Viewing, downloading, exhibiting or duplicating an illicit copy of the contents under this URL is punishable as an offence under the laws of India, including but not limited to under Sections 63, 63-A, 65 and 65-A of the Copyright Act, 1957 which prescribe imprisonment for 3 years and also fine of upto Rs 3,00,000/-.

1_1NqBBGk69vKmEpN4EHafCeUQh8veeyysTj.body:
> [nutomic](#comment_8_1FEikAyxCNPJcW996B69r5UFg29yfq579m): Use a VPN?

i already use windscribe as a vpn but i hear all vpns are slow for downloading!

so i wanted to brainstorm about the most secure torrent client .

> [another](#comment_4_1Ab7t6js2jJS3edzqo5jpcEerJJBPFGtH4): As a VPN user, yeah, it sucks. However, for whatever reason I was able to increase the speeds tremendously by setting a proxy on my torrent client. I have no idea how that works, but it does.Torrent client usually doesn't matter much in how anonymous your downloads are though.

What proxy do you use?

> [edantes](#comment_19_1JF3eQjW4voiKdcvCkMXvUx5bLmZAiVdyi): Forget the VPN. Get a cheap seedbox for like $5 a month. First you download the file to the box (its IP is used, not yours) and then you SFTP the file down to your desktop or whatever. As long as you're using SFTP (encrypted FTP) your ISP won't be able to know what exactly you are downloading.

i think this the route i will take.

> [klauszimmermann](#comment_46_15QGRquMETTn5LnCHjTm1qa9eaXGtq7gpT): Also, what a shitty piece of legislation.
> 
> Quite a costly thing to do, huh, visiting a website in 2016?

yep it is.
